subject: Mental Health
title: Social Media and Anxiety
description: A fast breakdown of Social Media and Anxiety for builders.

hook.text: You scroll for comfort but log off feeling worse. That's not a coincidence.

buildup.text: Social media fuels constant comparison, FOMO, and an infinite stream of bad news.

discovery.text: Studies link heavy social media use to significantly higher anxiety in teens.

twist.text: The platforms are designed to trigger small stress responses that keep you engaged.

climax.text: Reducing screen time by 30 minutes a day measurably lowers anxiety scores.

punchline.text: The app connecting you may be disconnecting your calm.

quiz.question: How do social media platforms contribute to anxiety?
options: They trigger comparison and stress responses
They have no effect on mental health
